in the condition that user inputs several error az, nc.availability_zone_list.return_value = [ {'zoneState': {'available': 1}, 'zoneName': 'AZ1'}, {'zoneState': {'available': 1}, 'zoneName': 'AZ2'}, {'zoneState': {'available': 1}, 'zoneName': 'AZ3'}, {'zoneState': {'available': 1}, 'zoneName': 'AZ4'} ] self.spec['properties']['zones'].append({'name': 'AZ5'}) policy = zp.ZonePlacementPolicy('test-policy', self.spec) policy._novaclient = nc result = policy._validate_zones(self.cluster) self.assertNotIn('AZ5', result) def test__validate_zones_failed(self): # in the condition that user inputs all error az, nc = mock.Mock() nc.availability_zone_list.return_value = [ {'zoneState': {'available': 1}, 'zoneName': 'AZ5'}, {'zoneState': {'available': 1}, 'zoneName': 'AZ6'}, ] policy = zp.ZonePlacementPolicy('test-policy', self.spec) policy._novaclient = nc result = policy._validate_zones(self.cluster) self.assertEqual(0, len(result)) def test__get_current_dist(self): node1 = mock.Mock() node1.data = {} node1.get_details.return_value = { 'OS-EXT-AZ:availability_zone': 'AZ1', } node2 = mock.Mock() node2.data = { 'foobar': 'irrelevant' } node3 = mock.Mock() node3.data = { 'placement': { 'zone': 'AZ2' } } cluster.nodes = [node1, node2, node3] policy = zp.ZonePlacementPolicy('test-policy', self.spec) zones = policy.zones result = policy._get_current_dist(self.context, zones, cluster) self.assertEqual(4, len(result)) self.assertEqual(1, result['AZ1']) self.assertEqual(1, result['AZ2']) self.assertEqual(0, result['AZ3']) self.assertEqual(0, result['AZ4']) def test_balance_strategy(self): # each az's ratio is same (default), test the placement plan = policy._create_plan(current, zones, 5) def test_ratio_strategy(self): # each az has different ratio,test the placement # should fix the num plan = policy._create_plan(current, zones, 7) @mock.patch.object(zp.ZonePlacementPolicy, '_get_current_dist') def test_pre_op(self, mock_get): # test pre_op method whether returns the correct action.data nc = mock.Mock() nc.availability_zone_list.return_value = [ {'zoneState': {'available': 1}, 'zoneName': 'AZ1'}, {'zoneState': {'available': 1}, 'zoneName': 'AZ2'}, {'zoneState': {'available': 1}, 'zoneName': 'AZ3'}, {'zoneState': {'available': 1}, 'zoneName': 'AZ4'} ] policy._novaclient = nc mock_get.return_value = {'AZ1': 2, 'AZ2': 2, 'AZ3': 2, 'AZ4': 1} cluster_base.Cluster.load = mock.Mock(return_value=self.cluster) action.inputs = {} policy.pre_op(self.cluster.id, action) placement = {'count': 1, 'placements': [{'zone': 'AZ1'}]} self.assertEqual(placement, action.data['placement']) action.data = {'creation': {'count': 7}} policy.pre_op(self.cluster.id, action) expected = [ {'zone': 'AZ1'}, {'zone': 'AZ1'}, {'zone': 'AZ1'}, {'zone': 'AZ2'}, {'zone': 'AZ2'}, {'zone': 'AZ3'}, {'zone': 'AZ4'} ] self.assertEqual(7, action.data['placement']['count']) placements = action.data['placement']['placements'] actual_sorted = sorted(placements, key=lambda x: x['zone']) self.assertEqual(expected, actual_sorted)

commit_message:
Fixed Ceilometer and Heat SWARM tests

We need to fix checks for ceilometer-api processes
because we shouldn't hardcode count of processes in
automated tests.

Co-Authored-By: Vitaly Gusev <vgusev@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Id3117459e273fcb86a44fe3972e9ede0b8d43354
Closes-Bug: #1529072

commit_message:
Fix failed puppet run and gateway unset

Failed puppet runs now properly cause an error in the UI.

Unsetting gateway when it is the default gateway now
unsets the gateway for the host.

Change-Id: I1a281da1632ab7ef7ff9274f61933d773634b15c
Partial-Bug: #1528437
(cherry picked from commit 1e05564a8cb6be167cceddac31449f133da0e096)

which seems too early (and becomes even more early with the patch).

commit_message:
Set BUILD status for ports right after update in DB

In case agent notification is needed after port update it is fair
to set BUILD status for the port as in fact agent needs to
process it before we can say this port is actual and active.
This fixes the bug when nova thinks it should not wait for any events
from neutron because all ports are already active.

L2 pop mech driver was updated to remove fdb entries for migrated
ports when their status changes from BUILD to ACTIVE - when l3 agent
reports that device is active. Originally fdb entries were removed
when ports status changed to BUILD (agent requests info for the port)
which seems too early (and becomes even more early with the patch).

Closes-Bug: #1522824
Related-Bug: #1450604
Change-Id: I2df34d7ccf7bd45a8d7e992a1c394453f0956612

commit_message:
Additional Role for Zaqar Deployments

Change-Id: I7beb1bcb2f7f7483eb34342cb1da6b0232829f3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-specs refs/changes/89/269889/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Additional Role for Zaqar Deployment ######################################## :date: 2016-01-20 11:20 :tags: zaqar, openstack-ansible The purpose of this spec is to add support for the OpenStack Zaqar program to OpenStack-Ansible. This would allow the deployment of Zaqar along with the core OpenStack components using OpenStack-Ansible. Blueprint - Zaqar deployment on OpenStack-Ansible: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+spec/role-zaqar Problem description =================== Presently, while deploying OpenStack using OpenStack-Ansible only the core OpenStack components get deployed. The deployment of other components (eg: Zaqar) on playbooks is not supported yet and to use other component's services, they need to be deployed manually. Proposed change =============== The Zaqar program encompasses a number of projects, but this spec and this proposed series of changes covers the initial implementation of support for Zaqar. This will involve adding support for the Zaqar server[1] and Zaqar client[2]. The proposed changes include: * Creation of an openstack-ansible-zaqar repository and Ansible role to support the deployment of Zaqar. * Tests to verify the new Ansible role. Alternatives ------------ None Playbook/Role impact -------------------- Test playbooks will be placed in the openstack-ansible-zaqar repository for functional testing purposes, with no initially proposed changes to OpenStack-Ansible playbooks. In the future, once the Zaqar role is found to be useful and acceptable, a future spec will address the integration of the Zaqar role with the main OpenStack-Ansible repository. Upgrade impact -------------- None Security impact --------------- None. Performance impact ------------------ None. End user impact --------------- Deployers will be able to deploy Zaqar and use messaging service through OpenStack-Ansible. Deployer impact --------------- When support for the new Zaqar role is added to the parent repository, new Zaqar specific configuration options will be made available. This will provide an optional role for use in the OpenStack-Ansible toolbox for the deployers. Developer impact ---------------- As this change is self-contained initially, no impact on other developers is expected. Dependencies ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Fei Long Wang ( IRC: flwang) Other contributors: None Work items ---------- #. Ask for the new repository, openstack-ansible-zaqar, to be created #. Create the role for Zaqar support * Add support for running zaqar-sever * Add support for including python-zaqarclient, which is the operator tool for supporting Zaqar. Testing ======= The usual gate checks can be used for these changes. Also, each individual commit can be functionally tested individually. Documentation impact ==================== Adding support to the user guide on how to enable Zaqar support will be required. References ========== * [1] The Zaqar server: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/zaqar/ * [2] The Zaqar client: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-zaqarclient/

commit_message:
Fix compatibility with Manilaclient and Horizon

Horizon has removed Saharaclient and Troveclient from its dependencies,
so, remove their code from Manila-UI too.
Latest release of Manilaclient v1.6.0 broke possibility to import
deprecated v1 API modules having b_u_g 1535692. So, change usage of

subject: Disable --save-only mode during post-deployment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-09 12:23:16.000000000', 'files': ['fuelmenu/fuelmenu/fuelmenu.py', 'fuelmenu/fuelmenu/common/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/7c4dc12b9e16ef8ad1354acd53c5a6eafbafd743', 'message': 'Disable --save-only mode during post-deployment

Backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242109/
(full link because fuelmenu now lives in a new gitrepo)

It is common for users to run bootstrap_admin_node to apply
a patch to Fuel Master, which has the side effect of calling
fuelmenu --save-only --iface=ethN. This behavior initializes
all fields to defaults, which has negative consequences.

Now fuelmenu --save-only --iface=ethN will result in a message
saying that the user should run full fuelmenu in order to make
changes.

Change-Id: I78d3261a5e2700b7533d9873f6bec9cc4e98c362
Closes-Bug: #1513486
'}]
commit_message:
Disable --save-only mode during post-deployment

Backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242109/
(full link because fuelmenu now lives in a new gitrepo)

It is common for users to run bootstrap_admin_node to apply
a patch to Fuel Master, which has the side effect of calling
fuelmenu --save-only --iface=ethN. This behavior initializes
all fields to defaults, which has negative consequences.

Now fuelmenu --save-only --iface=ethN will result in a message
saying that the user should run full fuelmenu in order to make
changes.

Change-Id: I78d3261a5e2700b7533d9873f6bec9cc4e98c362
Closes-Bug: #1513486

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging import subprocess log = logging.getLogger('fuelmenu.common.utils') def get_deployment_mode(): """Report if any fuel containers are already created.""" command = ['docker', 'ps', '-a'] try: process = subprocess.Popen(command, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE) output, errout = process.communicate() if "fuel" in output.lower(): return "post" else: return "pre" except OSError: log.warning('Unable to check deployment mode via docker. Assuming' ' pre-deployment stage.') return "pre"

commit_message:
Attempt to delete internal resources if create server fail

Attempt to delete queue/user/internal_ports if server hasn't
been created successful yet, to avoid some infos residue.

Closes-Bug: #1535227
Related-Bug: #1533074

commit_message:
Remove public_endpoint definition

Mitaka manifests treat false as a string False, rather
than unsetting the value. This parameter is no longer
used, so it should be simply removed.

blueprint puppet-mitaka

Change-Id: I3b8a0b22a4ed4a67cc6ee17a8f2b0281ac9249c4

commit_message:
Fix /NetworkDriver.CreateNetwork validation

Gateway should not be 'required' property as this is an option in
docker network command.

Change-Id: I9bf913176db4f7449a5f19d5c6a807769bc1aae3
Closes-Bug: #1532733

added_lines: from mistral.services import security class ResourceMember(mb.MistralModelBase): """Contains info about resource sharing members.""" __tablename__ = 'resource_members_v2' __table_args__ = ( sa.UniqueConstraint('resource_name', 'resource_type', 'member_id'), ) id = mb.id_column() resource_name = sa.Column(sa.String(80), nullable=False) resource_type = sa.Column( sa.String(50), nullable=False, default='workflow' ) project_id = sa.Column(sa.String(80), default=security.get_project_id) member_id = sa.Column(sa.String(36), nullable=False) status = sa.Column(sa.String(20), nullable=False, default="pending")

commit_message:
Properly handle bonds with associated bridges and VLAN-tagged interfaces

When a bond has a bridge associated with it and other VLAN-tagged interfaces on
different bridges then it is neccesary to retrieve informtion about the bond
by bridge name rather than by bond name.

Change-Id: Ife0e085c7be212798139a777691528579939eb82
Closes-bug: #1532810

commit_message:
Add documentation for audit

Add description for the audit configuration and short note about usage with
Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I40fa00d3667bea1aca81482abb3a7ad5b81e8761
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/anchor refs/changes/44/254544/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Audit ===== Anchor produces audit messages using the PyCADF library and aims for CADF compatibility. The two events being emited right now are ``audit.sign`` and ``audit.auth``, used for certificate signing and authentication events respectively. In the configuration, audit events can be sent either to the log stream, or to the standard openstack message queue. This is configured using the ``audit.target`` option. See the :doc:`configuration section <configuration>` for more details. Capturing events in Ceilometer ------------------------------ In order to get events processed by Ceilometer, two configuration files need to be provided - event pipeline and definitions. The default ``event_pipeline.yaml`` as described in Ceilometer documentation is compatible with Anchor. As for ``event_definitions.yaml``, it needs to include the ``audit.auth`` and ``audit.sign`` events. On the Ceilometer side, it needs the `notification agent`_ installed in order to receive data from the message queue. Add incoming events will then be saved and visible after running ``ceilometer event-list``. .. _notification agent: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ceilometer/architecture.html#notification-agents-listening-for-data

commit_message:
Fix the CoreOS Heat templates

This patch follows the CoreOS guidance for kubernetes:
https://coreos.com/kubernetes/docs/latest/getting-started.html

CoreOS doesn't support multi-part mime user-data, so we cannot pack
multiple scripts into one (which we did in Atomic). The major work of
this patch is to wrap each cloud-init script with a systemd unit,
which will be executed one-by-one at the first boot.

Note that this patch only enable a basic CoreOS support. Advanced
features (i.e. TLS, Cinder volume, HA, external load balancing) are
not included. These features need to be ported from Atomic as a
future work.

Partially-Implements: blueprint coreos-k8s-bay
Change-Id: Ib6fe76718ac9b198e0aae57618d3edd98792f15d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-15 13:03:49.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/f1a6ee8054f92c256f882df9c03b6fa0c71c072f', 'message': 'Allow adding new overcloud passwords

all or nothing.  If the file exists, then it uses that file as the
list of passwords, otherwise it generates an entirely new file.

This means that if we add a new service that requires a password to
be generated and a user upgrades with a password file generated by
an older version, we will not generate a new password for the new
service and pandemonium will result.

but loop through the names to make sure all of the expected passwords

commit_message:
Allow adding new overcloud passwords

The current implementation of the password generation function is
all or nothing.  If the file exists, then it uses that file as the
list of passwords, otherwise it generates an entirely new file.

This means that if we add a new service that requires a password to
be generated and a user upgrades with a password file generated by
an older version, we will not generate a new password for the new
service and pandemonium will result.

To address the problem, read in any existing passwords from the file,
but loop through the names to make sure all of the expected passwords
are set.  If any are not, generate them.  Behavior in the case of
no password file remains unchanged.

Change-Id: Id9c5fe363a2aef55800bee4db12cbf3e2d278e45

deleted_lines: return dict(line.split('=') for line in f.read().splitlines()) password_names = ( "OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_TOKEN", "OVERCLOUD_CEILOMETER_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_CEILOMETER_SECRET", "OVERCLOUD_CINDER_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_DEMO_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_GLANCE_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_HEAT_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_HEAT_STACK_DOMAIN_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_NEUTRON_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_NOVA_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_SWIFT_HASH", "OVERCLOUD_SWIFT_PASSWORD", ) passwords = dict((p, passutils.generate_password(size=_MIN_PASSWORD_SIZE)) for p in password_names)

commit_message:
Wait for cluster to settle in yum_update.sh

Occasionally we hit "Error: unable to push cib" during update. This is
probably due to the fact that when we try to replace cib in
yum_update.sh, services on the previous updated controller are still
coming up and changing cib, and racing/conflicting with the cib push
from yum_update.sh.

This commit adds waiting for the cluster to settle before exiting from
yum_update.sh, to avoid this kind of conflict.

Also a check for cib-push success is added, to make the update fail
properly instead of hanging indefinitely as we've observed with this
issue.

Change-Id: I953087e0e565474ac553fd57bea2459d2e3a6081
Closes-Bug: #1527644
(cherry picked from commit ac7467bacddb98fbb9fc9716ba56cad0d6f282de)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/73/263673/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cluster_settle_timeout=1800 if ! pcs cluster cib-push $pacemaker_dumpfile; then echo "ERROR failed to apply new pacemaker config" exit 1 fi echo "Waiting for pacemaker cluster to settle" if ! timeout -k 10 $cluster_settle_timeout crm_resource --wait; then echo "ERROR timed out while waiting for the cluster to settle" exit 1 fi

commit_message:
Allow adding new overcloud passwords

The current implementation of the password generation function is
all or nothing.  If the file exists, then it uses that file as the
list of passwords, otherwise it generates an entirely new file.

This means that if we add a new service that requires a password to
be generated and a user upgrades with a password file generated by
an older version, we will not generate a new password for the new
service and pandemonium will result.

To address the problem, read in any existing passwords from the file,
but loop through the names to make sure all of the expected passwords
are set.  If any are not, generate them.  Behavior in the case of
no password file remains unchanged.

Change-Id: Id9c5fe363a2aef55800bee4db12cbf3e2d278e45

commit_message:
Sheepdog: Change storelocation format

This patch changes storelocation format from 'sheepdog://image' to
'sheepdog://addr:port:image'. It add ip and port to the location.
This offers the advantages of:

1.The ip and port represents a sheepdog cluster which contains the
image. The format like 'sheepdog://addr:port:image' can describe image
location accurately.

2.When clone an image in cinder, it need ip and port to decide whether
the image is in the same sheepdog cluster with cinder-backend, this is
very important for us to determine if the image is cloneable.

This patch also change a long data type to int to compatible with
python version 3.x.

Change-Id: Id79487e05e3af2f7b1287476ddbb174ad9de78c8

commit_message:
remove python 2.6 trove classifier

- OpenStack projects are no longer being tested under Python 2.6,
  this change removes the trove classifier implying that this
  project supports 2.6.

Change-Id: I83dcdf95072eaa074c6ea0e74670ae5de98b43b3

commit_message:
Add refresh_zone_data method to update cluster zone info

In placement policy we should not only create placement plan, but
also store the zone information in cluster data. This data is in
the following format and will be used by deletion policy to make
deletion stragety.
cluster.data = {
    'az1': 10,
    'az2': 20,
}

Change-Id: Ia615584af75b2e07d21f91068995e7fe088c567a
Implements: blueprint cross-az-region-deletion-policy
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/69/267969/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test__refresh_zone_data(self): cluster = mock.Mock() cluster.data = {} cluster.set_status = mock.Mock() plan = { 'az1': 10, 'az2': 20, } policy = zp.ZonePlacementPolicy('test-policy', self.spec) policy._refresh_zone_data(self.context, cluster, plan) self.assertEqual(plan, cluster.data) # cluster data is not blank cluster.data = { 'az1': 5, 'az3': 8, } policy._refresh_zone_data(self.context, cluster, plan) new_data = { 'az1': 15, 'az2': 20, 'az3': 8, } self.assertEqual(new_data, cluster.data) @mock.patch.object(zp.ZonePlacementPolicy, '_refresh_zone_data') def test_pre_op(self, mock_get, mock_refresh):

commit_message:
reorder tox envlist to run python 3.4 before 2.7

- To resove a known issue with .testrepository where
  the db type cannont be determined if the 2.7 enviorment
  is run first. This change reorders the envlist to prevent
  this error.

Change-Id: I44bd372db7e944210e93d258fd4712e346b06619
Closes-Bug: #1534277
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-vif refs/changes/91/267791/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py34,py27,pep8

commit_message:
Introduce node name prefix for mgmt/messaging IPs

RabbitMQ will resolve <prefix>-<fqdn> hostnames to valid mgmt/messaging IP

Change-Id: Iaae019f63f8f601c2bb901f0b0cb95ef525261ce
Depends-On: Ifcfbdfe8bb5dd34332fb9aae55014a4c48c61a11
Closes-bug: #1528707
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/54/269754/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OCF_RESKEY_fqdn_prefix_default="": ${OCF_RESKEY_fqdn_prefix=${OCF_RESKEY_fqdn_prefix_default}}<parameter name="fqdn_prefix" unique="0" required="0"> <longdesc lang="en"> Optional FQDN prefix for RabbitMQ nodes in cluster. FQDN prefix can be specified to host multiple RabbitMQ instances on a node or in case of RabbitMQ running in dedicated network/interface. </longdesc> <shortdesc lang="en">FQDN prefix</shortdesc> <content type="string" default="${OCF_RESKEY_fqdn_prefix_default}" /> </parameter> echo "${OCF_RESKEY_fqdn_prefix}$1" | awk -F. '{print $1}' echo "${OCF_RESKEY_fqdn_prefix}$1" hostname=$(process_fqdn $(get_hostname))

commit_message:
Use puppet-openstack_spec_helper for Rakefile & spec_helper_acceptance

Use common code in puppet-openstack_spec_helper in Rakefile and
spec_helper_acceptance.

Change-Id: I96244525ca1251e475b16fa9538196837902f8aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/96/269096/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'puppet-openstack_spec_helper/beaker_spec_helper'
deleted_lines: require 'beaker-rspec' require 'beaker/puppet_install_helper' run_puppet_install_helper RSpec.configure do |c| # Project root proj_root = File.expand_path(File.join(File.dirname(__FILE__), '..')) modname = JSON.parse(open('metadata.json').read)['name'].split('-')[1] # Readable test descriptions c.formatter = :documentation # Configure all nodes in nodeset c.before :suite do # Install module and dependencies hosts.each do |host| # install git install_package host, 'git' zuul_ref = ENV['ZUUL_REF'] zuul_branch = ENV['ZUUL_BRANCH'] zuul_url = ENV['ZUUL_URL'] repo = 'openstack/puppet-openstack-integration' # Start out with clean moduledir, don't trust r10k to purge it on host, "rm -rf /etc/puppet/modules/*" # Install dependent modules via git or zuul r = on host, "test -e /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner", { :acceptable_exit_codes => [0,1] } if r.exit_code == 0 zuul_clone_cmd = '/usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner ' zuul_clone_cmd += '--cache-dir /opt/git ' zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-ref #{zuul_ref} " zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-branch #{zuul_branch} " zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-url #{zuul_url} " zuul_clone_cmd += "git://git.openstack.org #{repo}" on host, zuul_clone_cmd else on host, "git clone https://git.openstack.org/#{repo} #{repo}" end on host, "ZUUL_REF=#{zuul_ref} ZUUL_BRANCH=#{zuul_branch} ZUUL_URL=#{zuul_url} bash #{repo}/install_modules.sh" # Install the module being tested on host, "rm -fr /etc/puppet/modules/#{modname}" puppet_module_install(:source => proj_root, :module_name => modname) on host, "rm -fr #{repo}" # List modules installed to help with debugging on host, puppet('module','list'), { :acceptable_exit_codes => 0 } end end end

commit_message:
Upgrades Intern to 3.0.6

This change updates Intern testing framework from 2.2.2
to 3.0.6 version and updates ScreenshotOnFailReporter
to use newer API.

Change-Id: I368cb18756c9d27a95c1b615d4473d8486ada184

commit_message:
Update the new state machine spec with CLEANWAIT

This patch introduces the CLEANWAIT state to the new state machine spec.

Change-Id: I195ecd90e7e4165504da5ac330cee3fc7c3039c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/21/200521/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: When a node is in CLEANING state it means that the conductor is executing the one executing the clean step (out-of-band) or preparing the environment (building PXE configuration files, configuring the DHCP, etc..) to boot the ramdisk. CLEANWAIT Just like the CLEANING state, the nodes in CLEANWAIT are being prepared to become AVAILABLE. The difference is that in CLEANWAIT the clean step is running in-band in the node and the conductor is waiting it to finish.

commit_message:
Make the erase_devices clean step abortable

This patches updates the get_clean_steps() method to make the
erase_devices step abortable. Erasing devices is something that can be
cancelled without damaging the machine.

When a clean step is aborted the provision state of the Ironic node
will go to CLEANFAIL state. The operator can then do what is needed to
fix the problem (i.e network booting issues) and restart the cleaning
later on.

Partial-Bug: #1455825
Change-Id: Ic181ac3712810c6f6925e8b627ee79e77ecf4d83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/37/202137/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'abortable': Boolean value. Whether the clean step is abortable or not. 'reboot_requested': False, 'abortable': True

This patch allows a deployment in CLEANWAIT or DEPLOYWAIT to be
aborted.

For CLEANWAIT a new parameter called "abortable" was added to the
@clean_step decorator (we don't want to brick any machine). The value
of this parameter is a boolean value indicating whether the clean step
can be aborted or not. Defaults to True.

This patch allows a node in CLEANWAIT aborted.

The @clean_step decorator have been extended to accept a new parameter
"abortable". By default this parameter defaults to False since a clean
step could potentially brick a machine we better make it explicit.

If the clean step is abortable, the process of aborting will happen
immediately; if the clean step is not abortable the abortion will happen
as soon as the clean step is done. If a clean step is marked to be be
aborted later but there are no next clean steps to be done after it the
cleaning process will just finish successfully.

Partial-Bug: #1455825
Change-Id: Ia6846c048b3dab44a8280366a7305aca1d3eb783

This patch allows a node in CLEANWAIT to be aborted.

The @clean_step decorator has been extended to accept a new parameter
"abortable". By default this parameter defaults to False since a clean
step could potentially brick a machine so we better make it explicit.

If the clean step is abortable, the process of aborting will happen
immediately; if the clean step is not abortable the abortion will happen
as soon as the clean step is done. If a clean step is marked to have
the abortion done after its completion but it is the final clean step in
the cleaning operation the cleaning process will just finish successfully.

A new verb 'abort' is being added to the API and the microversion is
being bumped to 1.13.

commit_message:
Allow abort for CLEANWAIT states

This patch allows a node in CLEANWAIT to be aborted.

The @clean_step decorator has been extended to accept a new parameter
"abortable". By default this parameter defaults to False since a clean
step could potentially brick a machine so we better make it explicit.

If the clean step is abortable, the process of aborting will happen
immediately; if the clean step is not abortable the abortion will happen
as soon as the clean step is done. If a clean step is marked to have
the abortion done after its completion but it is the final clean step in
the cleaning operation the cleaning process will just finish successfully.

A new verb 'abort' is being added to the API and the microversion is
being bumped to 1.13.

Closes-Bug: #1455825
Change-Id: Ia6846c048b3dab44a8280366a7305aca1d3eb783

commit_message:
Add CLEANWAIT state

This patch adds the CLEANWAIT state. When a node is in CLEANWAIT means
that the ramdisk is executing a clean step (async). When the node is
in CLEANING state it means that the conductor is executing a clean step
(sync).

This is the first patch of a series that aim to make nodes in CLEANWAIT
abortable. We still need a way need some way to tell if a step is
abortable; aborting steps could have negative effects such as bricking
things.

Depends-On: I195ecd90e7e4165504da5ac330cee3fc7c3039c2
Co-Authored-By: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>
Partial-Bug: #1455825
Change-Id: Ic2bc4f147f68947f53d341fda5e0c8d7b594a553

added_lines: CLEANWAIT = 'wait clean call-back' """ Node is waiting to be cleaned. This will be the node `provision_state` while the node is waiting for the driver to finish cleaning step. """ machine.add_state(CLEANWAIT, target=AVAILABLE, **watchers)# A deployment may also wait on external callbacks machine.add_transition(CLEANING, CLEANWAIT, 'wait') machine.add_transition(CLEANWAIT, CLEANING, 'resume')

commit_message:
Use puppet-openstack_spec_helper for Rakefile & spec_helper_acceptance

Use common code in puppet-openstack_spec_helper in Rakefile and
spec_helper_acceptance.

Change-Id: Id95e433ef563cb2bc15e9cd2a0af85a0a2776a26
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/91/269091/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'puppet-openstack_spec_helper/beaker_spec_helper'
deleted_lines: require 'beaker-rspec' require 'beaker/puppet_install_helper' run_puppet_install_helper RSpec.configure do |c| # Project root proj_root = File.expand_path(File.join(File.dirname(__FILE__), '..')) modname = JSON.parse(open('metadata.json').read)['name'].split('-')[1] # Readable test descriptions c.formatter = :documentation # Configure all nodes in nodeset c.before :suite do # Install module and dependencies hosts.each do |host| # install git install_package host, 'git' zuul_ref = ENV['ZUUL_REF'] zuul_branch = ENV['ZUUL_BRANCH'] zuul_url = ENV['ZUUL_URL'] repo = 'openstack/puppet-openstack-integration' # Start out with clean moduledir, don't trust r10k to purge it on host, "rm -rf /etc/puppet/modules/*" # Install dependent modules via git or zuul r = on host, "test -e /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner", { :acceptable_exit_codes => [0,1] } if r.exit_code == 0 zuul_clone_cmd = '/usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner ' zuul_clone_cmd += '--cache-dir /opt/git ' zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-ref #{zuul_ref} " zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-branch #{zuul_branch} " zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-url #{zuul_url} " zuul_clone_cmd += "git://git.openstack.org #{repo}" on host, zuul_clone_cmd else on host, "git clone https://git.openstack.org/#{repo} #{repo}" end on host, "ZUUL_REF=#{zuul_ref} ZUUL_BRANCH=#{zuul_branch} ZUUL_URL=#{zuul_url} bash #{repo}/install_modules.sh" # Install the module being tested on host, "rm -fr /etc/puppet/modules/#{modname}" puppet_module_install(:source => proj_root, :module_name => modname) on host, "rm -fr #{repo}" # List modules installed to help with debugging on host, puppet('module','list'), { :acceptable_exit_codes => 0 } end end end

commit_message:
Implement prefixed hostnames support

in the network_metadata_to_hosts() parser function.

This functional required for separation nova live migration
and RMQ-server to dedicated networks.

Change-Id: Ifcfbdfe8bb5dd34332fb9aae55014a4c48c61a11
Related-bug: 1528707

added_lines: Call network_metadata_to_hosts(network_metadata, 'network/role', 'optional_prefix') unless args.size == 1 or args.size == 3 raise(Puppet::ParseError, 'network_metadata_to_hosts(): Wrong number of arguments, need one or three') end hosts = Hash.new nodes = args[0].fetch('nodes', {}) network_role = (args[1].to_s == '' ? 'mgmt/vip' : args[1].to_s) prefix = args[2].to_s fqdn = "#{prefix}#{props['fqdn']}" hosts[fqdn]={:ip=>props['network_roles'][network_role],:host_aliases=>["#{prefix}#{name}"]} notice("Generating host entry #{name} #{props['network_roles'][network_role]} #{props['fqdn']}")# vim: set ts=2 sw=2 et :

When an ssl certificate is configured, configures haproxy with said
certificate in front of the public API endpoints for the services.
If no certificate is configured, leaves everything setup as before.

Change-Id: Idd9492303e797f5b39c980772f33754fb44a9f12

commit_message:
Enable loadbalancer with ssl on undercloud

When an ssl certificate is configured, configures haproxy with said
certificate in front of the public API endpoints for the services.
If no certificate is configured, leaves everything setup as before.

Change-Id: Idd9492303e797f5b39c980772f33754fb44a9f12
(cherry picked from commit 1f17076e09a7813dbf4b5de047f981c9fada552c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/76/265376/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_generate_endpoints(self): env = undercloud._generate_environment('.') endpoint_vars = {k: v for (k, v) in env.items() if k.startswith('UNDERCLOUD_ENDPOINT')} self.assertEqual(27, len(endpoint_vars)) # Spot check one service self.assertEqual('http://192.0.2.1:5000', env['UNDERCLOUD_ENDPOINT_KEYSTONE_PUBLIC']) self.assertEqual('http://192.0.2.1:5000', env['UNDERCLOUD_ENDPOINT_KEYSTONE_INTERNAL']) self.assertEqual('http://192.0.2.1:35357', env['UNDERCLOUD_ENDPOINT_KEYSTONE_ADMIN']) # Also check that the tenant id part is preserved self.assertEqual('http://192.0.2.1:8080/v1/AUTH_%(tenant_id)s', env['UNDERCLOUD_ENDPOINT_SWIFT_PUBLIC']) def test_generate_endpoints_ssl(self): conf = config_fixture.Config() self.useFixture(conf) conf.config(undercloud_service_certificate='test.pem') env = undercloud._generate_environment('.') # Spot check one service self.assertEqual('https://192.0.2.2:13000', env['UNDERCLOUD_ENDPOINT_KEYSTONE_PUBLIC']) self.assertEqual('http://192.0.2.1:5000', env['UNDERCLOUD_ENDPOINT_KEYSTONE_INTERNAL']) self.assertEqual('http://192.0.2.1:35357', env['UNDERCLOUD_ENDPOINT_KEYSTONE_ADMIN']) # Also check that the tenant id part is preserved self.assertEqual('https://192.0.2.2:13808/v1/AUTH_%(tenant_id)s', env['UNDERCLOUD_ENDPOINT_SWIFT_PUBLIC']) def test_absolute_cert_path(self): conf = config_fixture.Config() self.useFixture(conf) conf.config(undercloud_service_certificate='/home/stack/test.pem') env = undercloud._generate_environment('.') self.assertEqual('/home/stack/test.pem', env['UNDERCLOUD_SERVICE_CERTIFICATE']) def test_relative_cert_path(self): conf = config_fixture.Config() self.useFixture(conf) conf.config(undercloud_service_certificate='test.pem') env = undercloud._generate_environment('.') self.assertEqual(os.path.join(os.getcwd(), 'test.pem'), env['UNDERCLOUD_SERVICE_CERTIFICATE']) def test_no_cert_path(self): env = undercloud._generate_environment('.') self.assertEqual('', env['UNDERCLOUD_SERVICE_CERTIFICATE'])

commit_message:
Use puppet-openstack_spec_helper for Rakefile & spec_helper_acceptance

Use common code in puppet-openstack_spec_helper in Rakefile and
spec_helper_acceptance.

Change-Id: Ia20f9207874fe69618b215e24c4ec5113ecb86be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-vswitch refs/changes/00/269100/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'puppet-openstack_spec_helper/beaker_spec_helper'
deleted_lines: require 'beaker-rspec' require 'beaker/puppet_install_helper' run_puppet_install_helper RSpec.configure do |c| # Project root proj_root = File.expand_path(File.join(File.dirname(__FILE__), '..')) modname = JSON.parse(open('metadata.json').read)['name'].split('-')[1] # Readable test descriptions c.formatter = :documentation # Configure all nodes in nodeset c.before :suite do # Install module and dependencies hosts.each do |host| # install git install_package host, 'git' zuul_ref = ENV['ZUUL_REF'] zuul_branch = ENV['ZUUL_BRANCH'] zuul_url = ENV['ZUUL_URL'] repo = 'openstack/puppet-openstack-integration' # Start out with clean moduledir, don't trust r10k to purge it on host, "rm -rf /etc/puppet/modules/*" # Install dependent modules via git or zuul r = on host, "test -e /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner", { :acceptable_exit_codes => [0,1] } if r.exit_code == 0 zuul_clone_cmd = '/usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner ' zuul_clone_cmd += '--cache-dir /opt/git ' zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-ref #{zuul_ref} " zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-branch #{zuul_branch} " zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-url #{zuul_url} " zuul_clone_cmd += "git://git.openstack.org #{repo}" on host, zuul_clone_cmd else on host, "git clone https://git.openstack.org/#{repo} #{repo}" end on host, "ZUUL_REF=#{zuul_ref} ZUUL_BRANCH=#{zuul_branch} ZUUL_URL=#{zuul_url} bash #{repo}/install_modules.sh" # Install the module being tested on host, "rm -fr /etc/puppet/modules/#{modname}" puppet_module_install(:source => proj_root, :module_name => modname) on host, "rm -fr #{repo}" # List modules installed to help with debugging on host, puppet('module','list'), { :acceptable_exit_codes => 0 } end end end

subject: Remove purge_deleted from senlin-manage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-18 08:08:24.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/cmd/manage.py', 'doc/source/man/senlin-manage.rst', 'senlin/db/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/5a9534631a4da74ecc96b442fb24be3c985bc1c5', 'message': "Remove purge_deleted from senlin-manage

We now don't have support to soft-delete in database, so the
purge_deleted command doesn't make any senses. This patch removes it.

Change-Id: I1b3e69524dd497e6d7bf74abeabe0e81889b543f
"}]
commit_message:
Remove purge_deleted from senlin-manage

We now don't have support to soft-delete in database, so the
purge_deleted command doesn't make any senses. This patch removes it.

Change-Id: I1b3e69524dd497e6d7bf74abeabe0e81889b543f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/15/268915/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Added release notes about recent changes
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/18/268418/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Profile types and policy types are explicitly versioned now. We have the version string appended to the type names for easier detection.

subject: Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-14 12:36:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler/commit/57a07454fc171fb214b57325f44ce3adbe8d8704', 'message': 'Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess

commit_message:
Fix E713 and F811 errors in tacker code

This Patch fixes all E713 and F811 errors and
enables this test for all new patches to tacker.

E713 test for membership should be not in
F811 redefinition of unused variable

see OpenStack Style Guidelines
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/

Change-Id: I2f73c11bb5f89b3d3c2a85417ad5098fd21e580d
Related-Bug: 1515930

"notification_driver" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated

commit_message:
Remove duplicate section on glance api doc

The content for the section "Retrieve Raw Image Data" is simply a
dupe of the section "Retrieve Image Metadata", so removed one.

Change-Id: I2444263b1c9f45feda7b92ed55766c79e0eb9667
Closes-Bug: #1532656
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/52/270052/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Retrieve Image Metadata *********************** We want to see detailed information for a specific virtual machine image that the Glance server knows about. We have queried the Glance server for a list of images and the data returned includes the `uri` field for each available image. This `uri` field value contains the exact location needed to get the metadata for a specific image. Continuing the example from above, in order to get metadata about the first image returned, we can issue a ``HEAD`` request to the Glance server for the image's URI. We issue a ``HEAD`` request to ``http://glance.example.com/v1/images/71c675ab-d94f-49cd-a114-e12490b328d9`` to retrieve complete metadata for that image. The metadata is returned as a set of HTTP headers that begin with the prefix ``x-image-meta-``. The following shows an example of the HTTP headers returned from the above ``HEAD`` request:: x-image-meta-uri http://glance.example.com/v1/images/71c675ab-d94f-49cd-a114-e12490b328d9 x-image-meta-name Ubuntu 10.04 Plain 5GB x-image-meta-disk_format vhd x-image-meta-container_format ovf x-image-meta-size 5368709120 x-image-meta-checksum c2e5db72bd7fd153f53ede5da5a06de3 x-image-meta-created_at 2010-02-03 09:34:01 x-image-meta-updated_at 2010-02-03 09:34:01 x-image-meta-deleted_at x-image-meta-status available x-image-meta-is_public true x-image-meta-min_ram 256 x-image-meta-min_disk 0 x-image-meta-owner null x-image-meta-property-distro Ubuntu 10.04 LTS .. note:: All timestamps returned are in UTC. The `x-image-meta-updated_at` timestamp is the timestamp when an image's metadata was last updated, not its image data, as all image data is immutable once stored in Glance. There may be multiple headers that begin with the prefix `x-image-meta-property-`. These headers are free-form key/value pairs that have been saved with the image metadata. The key is the string after `x-image-meta-property-` and the value is the value of the header. The response's `ETag` header will always be equal to the `x-image-meta-checksum` value. The response's `x-image-meta-is_public` value is a boolean indicating whether the image is publicly available. The response's `x-image-meta-owner` value is a string which may either be null or which will indicate the owner of the image.

commit_message:
Enable nova driver to validate azs

This patch enables nova driver to validate availability zones.

Change-Id: Id737e91e26a4d902fc054960aa89e8853f459207
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/22/270022/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import log from senlin.common.i18n import _LWLOG = log.getLogger(__name__) def validate_azs(self, azs): """check whether availability zones provided are valid. :param azs: A list of availability zone names for checking. :returns: A list of zones that are found available on Nova. """ known = self.availability_zone_list() names = [az['zoneName'] for az in known if az['zoneState']['available']] found = [] for az in azs: if az in names: found.append(az) else: LOG.warning(_LW("Availability zone '%s' is not available."), az) return found

commit_message:
Minor refactor

1. SingletonMeta -> modified to allow handling multiple classes and moved to metaclasses too.
2. @logwrap : process asserts too

Changes reason:
 @logwrap was changed during test debug (was assert in wrapped function
 and stacktrace was not enough for reason understand) and moved out of
 test changest due to not mandatory for this test.
 Pros: Now assert, raised in wrapped function is recorded in log with
 details.

 SingletonMeta: was changed as "nice to have" during work on plugin
 helpers. Later plugin helpers was moved out of SshManager, and all code
 changes was moved to this changeset.
 Pros: Single way for handling the same tasks in different places.
 Previously SshManager used Metaclass, which could not be reused for
 more, than one class and Environment used __new__ directly written
 in class code.

Related-Bug: #1518979
Related-Bug: #1519050

Change-Id: I798302879400747909229cc208f97a669f25bbf3

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc.import tracebackfrom fuelweb_test.helpers import metaclasses __metaclass__ = metaclasses.SingletonMeta # Slots is used to prevent uncontrolled attributes set or remove. __slots__ = [ '__connections', 'admin_ip', 'admin_port', 'login', '__password' ] self.__connections = {} # Disallow direct type change and deletion self.__password = None @property def connections(self): return self.__connections self.__password = password password=self.__password, def execute_async_on_remote(self, ip, cmd, port=22): remote = self._get_remote(ip=ip, port=port) return remote.execute_async(cmd)
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2015 Mirantis, Inc. class SingletonMeta(type): def __init__(cls, name, bases, dict): super(SingletonMeta, cls).__init__(name, bases, dict) cls.instance = None def __call__(self, *args, **kw): if self.instance is None: self.instance = super(SingletonMeta, self).__call__(*args, **kw) return self.instance def __getattr__(cls, name): return getattr(cls(), name) __metaclass__ = SingletonMeta self.connections = {} self.password = None self.password = password password=self.password,

commit_message:
[Django 1.9] Update template.base.Library() import

Adds a wrapper for Django 1.9 for the usage of the Library() function,
as the import path has changed.

Change-Id: I93c37bfaef6bc29c85d2e6a570cf552d685f711e
Partially-implements: blueprint drop-dj17
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/80/269180/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import django from django import templateif django.VERSION >= (1, 9): register = template.Library() else: register = template.base.Library()

commit_message:
Add validation for following cases.
* use L2 Gateway Service without Gateway Device Management Service
* create l2-gateway with non-existent gateway device.
* create l2-gateway-connection with non-existent network.
* create l2-gateway-connection with non-existent l2_gateway.

Change-Id: I4f00af838aae9c7fbfd255bcccf4635cefdb39a9
Closes-Bug: #1531453

commit_message:
Breaking out blacklists

This change removes the old blacklist plugins and replaces them
with new built in functionality that loads blacklist item data
from a new plugin entry point. The new test also improve on the
old functionality that was broken in the following way:

import xml.sax # issue found OK
from xml import sax # no issue found, wrong

Finally, this patch removes the use of filename style wild cards
such as * from the import blacklist matching, as this was not being
used. Both this test and the old ones will alert on any import from
within the blacklisted namespace.

Change-Id: I98af6daf3c54561c0e4b399605ea615b42b7b283
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bandit refs/changes/87/268387/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bandit.blacklists = calls = bandit.blacklists.calls:gen_blacklist imports = bandit.blacklists.imports:gen_blacklist

commit_message:
Fix endpoint_types

Endpoint types does not get set as when the shell creates the client
object the endpoint_type is not passed.

This causes the client to default the endpoint type to 'public'.

This change passes endpoint_type from the shell to the client.

Change-Id: I12afb072174d25152223a77601546ed26b5e5b62
Closes-Bug: 1535396

commit_message:
Remove keypair ID from details table

Currently Horizon shows keypdair.id in
project->compute->access&security->keypairs
-> keypair details tab.
But python-novaclient always returns
keypair.id=keypair.name.

Right now Nova sends ID in its response and python-novaclient got it,
but python-novaclient does not pass that ID into the Horizon.
And keypair-id is also shown via nova-cli.
But Nova folks says that ID is a some kind of private atrtr in Nova,
and that fact it is shown via cli is a side-effect and should be fiexed.

So, Horizon should not use keypair-id and this patch removes it.

Change-Id: Idd13b8900342fb98675fc8c98fff016109d8161b
Closes-Bug: #1527257

commit_message:
prechecks: remove the docker max version check

Remove the docker max version check since we are not pinning
docker version any more.

Partially-Implements: blueprint precheck-tasks

Make senlin-api a console script entry point

Make senlin-api a console script entry point, delete
senlin-api and senlin-manage from bin/ folder.

commit_message:
Check the location url before update

When the image's locations are changed, the image_locations table
in db will be changed as well even though it raises errors during
the update action. So we need check the location url before update
to ensure the location change is effective.

Change-Id: Iba514d3c4b964bd581a46eb89351e06aa2543360
Closes-bug: #1529572

commit_message:
Rework region placement policy

This rework enables region placement policy to handle CLUSTER_SCALE_IN
action, i.e. an action that shrinks a cluster.

Change-Id: Ib0772a86f9c17da23b4722798867e73a63d6ef64
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/15/269715/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Policy for scheduling nodes across multiple regions. action.data['deletion']: - count: number of nodes to delete. It can be a decision from a scaling policy. If there is no scaling policy in effect, we assume the count value to be 1. Output: action.data: A dictionary containing scheduling decisions made. For actions that increase the size of a cluster, the output will look like:: 'creation': { 'regions': ['RegionOne', 'RegionTwo'] } } For actions that shrink the size of a cluster, the output will look like:: { 'status': 'OK', 'deletion': { 'count': 2, 'regions': ['RegionOne', 'RegionTwo'] } } PRIORITY = 300 ('BEFORE', consts.CLUSTER_SCALE_IN), def _keystone(self, obj): def _create_plan(self, current, regions, count, expand): :param count: Number of nodes to create/delete in this plan. :param expand: True if the plan is for inflating the cluster, False otherwise. :returns: A list of region names selected for the nodes. reverse=expand) if expand: total = count + sum(current.values()) else: total = sum(current.values()) - count q = total * r_weight / float(sum_weight) if expand: quota = int(math.ceil(q)) # respect the cap setting, if any if r_cap >= 0: quota = min(quota, r_cap) headroom = quota - current[r_name] else: quota = int(math.floor(q)) headroom = current[r_name] - quota remain = 0 break # we have leftovers result = [] for reg, count in plan.items(): if count > 0: result.extend([reg] * count) return result """Callback function when cluster membership is about to change. if action.action == consts.CLUSTER_SCALE_IN: expand = False # use action input directly if available count = action.inputs.get('count', None) if not count: # check if policy decisions available pd = action.data.get('deletion', None) count = pd.get('count', 1) if pd else 1 else: # this is an action that inflates the cluster expand = True count = action.inputs.get('count', None) if not count: # check if policy decisions available pd = action.data.get('creation', None) count = pd.get('count', 1) if pd else 1 kc = self._keystone(cluster) regions_good = kc.validate_regions(self.regions.keys()) if len(regions_good) == 0: regions = {} for r in self.regions.items(): if r[0] in regions_good: regions[r[0]] = r[1] current_dist = cluster.get_region_distribution(regions_good) result = self._create_plan(current_dist, regions, count, expand) if not result: 'handle all nodes.') LOG.error(_LE('There is no feasible plan to handle all nodes.')) if expand: if 'creation' not in action.data: action.data['creation'] = {} action.data['creation']['count'] = count action.data['creation']['regions'] = result else: if 'deletion' not in action.data: action.data['deletion'] = {} action.data['deletion']['count'] = count action.data['deletion']['regions'] = result
deleted_lines: Policy for placing nodes across multiple regions.Output: stored in action.data: A dictionary containing scheduling decisions made. 'placement': { 'placements': [ { 'region': 'RegionOne', }, { 'region': 'RegionTwo', } ] } }from senlin.common.i18n import _LW def keystone(self, obj): def _validate_regions(self, cluster): """check whether regions in spec are valid. :param cluster: the cluster object that policy attached to. :returns: A list of regions that are found available on Nova. """ known_regions = [r['id'] for r in self.keystone(cluster).region_list()] regions = {} for r in self.regions: if r not in known_regions: LOG.warning(_LW('Region %s is not found.'), r) else: regions[r] = self.regions[r] return regions def _get_current_dist(self, regions, nodes): """Calculate the region distribution for exiting nodes. :param regions: list of regions to check. :param nodes: the nodes for which the distribution is checked. :returns: a dict containing region-count pairs. """ dist = dict.fromkeys(regions.keys(), 0) for node in nodes: placement = node.data.get('placement', {}) if placement and 'region_name' in placement: region = placement['region_name'] dist[region] += 1 return dist def _create_plan(self, current, regions, count): :param count: Number of nodes to create in this plan. :returns: A dict that contains a placement plan. reverse=True) total = count + sum(current.values()) quota = int(math.ceil(total * r_weight / float(sum_weight))) # respect the cap setting, if any if r_cap >= 0: quota = min(quota, r_cap) # number of nodes that can be allocated to region candidates[i] headroom = quota - current[r_name] return plan # we have leftovers that cannot fit into any region return plan """Callback function when new nodes are to be created for a cluster. pd = action.data.get('creation', None) if pd: count = pd.get('count', 1) else: # If no scaling policy is attached, use the input count directly count = action.inputs.get('count', 1) regions = self._validate_regions(cluster) if len(regions) == 0: # Calculate AZ distribution for exiting nodes current_dist = self._get_current_dist(regions, cluster.nodes) # Calculate placement plan for new nodes plan = self._create_plan(current_dist, regions, count) if plan is None: 'accommodate all nodes.') LOG.error(_LE('There is no feasible plan to accommodate all ' 'nodes.')) placement = action.data.get('placement', {}) placement['count'] = count placement['placements'] = [] for az, count in plan.items(): if count > 0: entry = {'region_name': az} placement['placements'].extend([entry] * count) action.data.update({'placement': placement}) return

commit_message:
Cap installed pip to be < 8

Pip 8 just release which made uninstalling distutils installed packages
fatal. This was previously a deprecation warning and is now causing all
dsvm jobs to fail.

Depends-On: I511d216d9d8619c7cf919c482aaead4e833cdaac
Change-Id: I22f5c3af1adf96cfbd5747122f915a82e947843a

commit_message:
Make pipeline_property less brittle

wsgi.pipeline_property is used by internal client
to access properties of the proxy server. It
currently relies on each filter in the pipeline
storing a reference to its next filter as an
attribute named 'app'. This works fine but is
vulnerable to any middleware not following that
naming convention.

This patch overrides loadwsgi.load_app in
swift/common/wsgi.py so that a list of the
pipeline filter instances is kept, and uses that
list to search down the pipeline for a
pipeline_property.

Change-Id: Ia3d830fac20ac6f49cb1cd9f203b18adf48a93c5

commit_message:
Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess

os.popen() is deprecated since python 2.6.
Resolved with use of subprocess module

Change-Id: I380790ab5c1baa227114fa5e59d4936eb875de01

deleted_lines: git_cmd = "/usr/bin/git log | head -n1 | cut -f2 -d' '" gitsha = os.popen(git_cmd).read().strip('\n')

commit_message:
Hash domains by name

Currently every project and user resource generates a call to
fetch_domain, which is an unhashed query to the openstack domain show
command. This is very wasteful and does not scale well. This patch takes
the code that hashes domains by id and generates an inverse, a hash of
domains by name. This code is used in place of fetch_domain, which is
removed. Since the only thing used in this hash is the id, which should
be immutable, we should not have issues with the other fields changing
(like description and enabled).

This should provide a performance boost to users who have a lot of users
and projects, especially if everything is in the default domain.

Co-Authored-By: Denis Egorenko <degorenko@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I99d8fe272aedc0cbc6ad48561ea50a7b7d6cdb1e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/77/266677/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def self.domain_id_from_name(name) unless @domain_name_hash list = request('domain', 'list') @domain_name_hash = Hash[list.collect{|domain| [domain[:id], domain[:name]]}] end unless @domain_name_hash.include?(name) id = request('domain', 'show', name)[:id] @domain_name_hash[name] = id if id end unless @domain_name_hash.include?(name) err("Could not find domain with name [#{name}]") end @domain_name_hash[name] domain_id = self.domain_id_from_name(domain_name)
deleted_lines: def self.fetch_domain(domain) request('domain', 'show', domain) rescue Puppet::ExecutionFailure => e raise e unless e.message =~ /No domain with a name or ID/ domain = fetch_domain(domain_name) domain_id = domain ? domain[:id] : nil

commit_message:
test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

each config option has limitation for type and value. In production
code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input is valid, but in unit test,
test methods can pass if we use method CONF.set_override without
parameter enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong value
to config option. This commit makes sure calling method
CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True

Change-Id: Iac8cc0f655e96d66bf9701be4791f310631788a5
Related-Bug: #1517839
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/18/268618/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.conf.set_override('driver', 'null', 'storage', enforce_type=True)

commit_message:
Fix the duplicate nics for VMs

Before allocate_for_instance updates the net information cache,
the cache has likely beeen updated with the net information
by other threads. This will lead to duplicate nics stored
into cache.

This patch removes the old net cache entries to avoid duplicate
entries in net cache.

Change-Id: I0753f148cca1a49df4d0fee38cbe8771982325f5
Closes-bug: 1515768
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/252824/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_duplicate_entry(nw_info): if not nw_info: LOG.exception("Empty nw_info") return ids = set() for vif in nw_info: ids.add(vif['id']) if len(ids) != len(nw_info): try: raise Exception("duplicate network entry") except Exception: LOG.exception("duplicate network entry") check_duplicate_entry(nw_info) check_duplicate_entry(nw_info)

commit_message:
Use puppet-openstack_spec_helper for Rakefile & spec_helper_acceptance

Use common code in puppet-openstack_spec_helper in Rakefile and
spec_helper_acceptance.

Change-Id: I582daa9a5af1b8f4075422245e2e49838f4b2c49
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-murano refs/changes/90/269090/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'puppet-openstack_spec_helper/beaker_spec_helper'
deleted_lines: require 'beaker-rspec' require 'beaker/puppet_install_helper' run_puppet_install_helper RSpec.configure do |c| # Project root proj_root = File.expand_path(File.join(File.dirname(__FILE__), '..')) modname = JSON.parse(open('metadata.json').read)['name'].split('-')[1] # Readable test descriptions c.formatter = :documentation # Configure all nodes in nodeset c.before :suite do # Install module and dependencies hosts.each do |host| # install git install_package host, 'git' zuul_ref = ENV['ZUUL_REF'] zuul_branch = ENV['ZUUL_BRANCH'] zuul_url = ENV['ZUUL_URL'] repo = 'openstack/puppet-openstack-integration' # Start out with clean moduledir, don't trust r10k to purge it on host, "rm -rf /etc/puppet/modules/*" # Install dependent modules via git or zuul r = on host, "test -e /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner", { :acceptable_exit_codes => [0,1] } if r.exit_code == 0 zuul_clone_cmd = '/usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner ' zuul_clone_cmd += '--cache-dir /opt/git ' zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-ref #{zuul_ref} " zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-branch #{zuul_branch} " zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-url #{zuul_url} " zuul_clone_cmd += "git://git.openstack.org #{repo}" on host, zuul_clone_cmd else on host, "git clone https://git.openstack.org/#{repo} #{repo}" end on host, "ZUUL_REF=#{zuul_ref} ZUUL_BRANCH=#{zuul_branch} ZUUL_URL=#{zuul_url} bash #{repo}/install_modules.sh" # Install the module being tested on host, "rm -fr /etc/puppet/modules/#{modname}" puppet_module_install(:source => proj_root, :module_name => modname) on host, "rm -fr #{repo}" # List modules installed to help with debugging on host, puppet('module','list'), { :acceptable_exit_codes => 0 } end end end

commit_message:
Support hacking H104

H104 checks that empty files do not contain license headers. This
patch enables that check and fixes a couple files impacted.

Change-Id: I8ede271bfdb0e53d01cfebc69ac398e849a0e1aa

deleted_lines: require 'beaker-rspec' require 'beaker/puppet_install_helper' run_puppet_install_helper RSpec.configure do |c| # Project root proj_root = File.expand_path(File.join(File.dirname(__FILE__), '..')) modname = JSON.parse(open('metadata.json').read)['name'].split('-')[1] # Readable test descriptions c.formatter = :documentation # Configure all nodes in nodeset c.before :suite do # Install module and dependencies hosts.each do |host| # install git install_package host, 'git' zuul_ref = ENV['ZUUL_REF'] zuul_branch = ENV['ZUUL_BRANCH'] zuul_url = ENV['ZUUL_URL'] repo = 'openstack/puppet-openstack-integration' # Start out with clean moduledir, don't trust r10k to purge it on host, "rm -rf /etc/puppet/modules/*" # Install dependent modules via git or zuul r = on host, "test -e /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner", { :acceptable_exit_codes => [0,1] } if r.exit_code == 0 zuul_clone_cmd = '/usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner ' zuul_clone_cmd += '--cache-dir /opt/git ' zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-ref #{zuul_ref} " zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-branch #{zuul_branch} " zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-url #{zuul_url} " zuul_clone_cmd += "git://git.openstack.org #{repo}" on host, zuul_clone_cmd else on host, "git clone https://git.openstack.org/#{repo} #{repo}" end on host, "ZUUL_REF=#{zuul_ref} ZUUL_BRANCH=#{zuul_branch} ZUUL_URL=#{zuul_url} bash #{repo}/install_modules.sh" # Install the module being tested on host, "rm -fr /etc/puppet/modules/#{modname}" puppet_module_install(:source => proj_root, :module_name => modname) on host, "rm -fr #{repo}" # List modules installed to help with debugging on host, puppet('module','list'), { :acceptable_exit_codes => 0 } end end end

commit_message:
Add fixed priority for built-in policies

This patch adds fixed priority for built-in policies, including
lb policy, scaling policy, deletion policy, zone_placement policy
and region_placement policy.

Change-Id: I0c7416d6ad0c96f115c1619d908069bedad0a04b
Partially-implements: blueprint rework-policy-check
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/78/269478/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PRIORITY = 200

commit_message:
Replace string format arguments with function parameters

There are files containing string format arguments inside logging
messages. Using logging function parameters should be preferred.
Details available at http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0282/.

Also, move log.debug() to neutronclient.shell module to make sure
all commands have log.debug in run() to keep consistent.

Based on the work of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/94345/

Change-Id: Ic64857878069357b2fcc0db0755d82e492dcca15
Closes-Bug: #1321754

commit_message:
Fix for the deprecated library function

os.popen() is deprecated since version 2.6. Resolved with use of
subprocess module.

Change-Id: Ifb5dabcc65bab921471f41fff3ce50a5a9695b9b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/36/263636/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Cap virtualenv<14

Pip 8 was just released and now makes uninstalling distutils installed
packages fatal and this breaks a lot of things. We need to cap pip<8
however, virtualenv 14 was released in tandem and bundles pip8. So
when we install virtualenv 14 this breaks the kilo jobs. Liberty and
master don't have this issue because of constraints.

Change-Id: I41852343a0606bd5b2cc76c98507e9ede7381696

commit_message:
Get Accounts by Cluster

Cluster operators need to be able to gather information about all Swift
accounts in the cluster for utilization and auditing purposes. There is
no central list of all accounts in the Swift cluster, so each operator
must implement a method to discover accounts on their own. This patch
aims to build a simple method that all operators can use to get
information about accounts stored in the cluster. The idea is to use a
Watcher hooked into the Account Auditor to collect account data
and Swift Recon to present it.

Change-Id: If1ce42f4e2f30f0b72975790aeeec215f2fe231b

the_tempfile.flush() def see_object(self, account_path): pickle.dump(['see_object', account_path], the_tempfile) the_tempfile.flush() def end(self): if self._ended: raise Exception("don't call it [(os.path.join(self.testdir, f), '', '') for f in files] fake_entry_point = mock.Mock() fake_entry_point.configure_mock( load=lambda: TestWatcher, name='test_watcher1') conf = self.conf.copy() conf['watchers'] = 'test_watcher1' with mock.patch('pkg_resources.iter_entry_points', lambda group: iter([fake_entry_point])): test_auditor = auditor.AccountAuditor(conf, self.logger) with mock.patch('swift.account.auditor.audit_location_generator', fake_audit_location_generator): test_auditor.logging_interval = 0 test_auditor._one_audit_pass(test_auditor.logging_interval) calls = [] the_tempfile.seek(0) while True: try: calls.append(pickle.load(the_tempfile)) except EOFError: break self.assertEqual(len(calls), 8) self.assertEqual(calls[0], ["__init__", conf, id(self.logger)]) self.assertEqual(calls[1], ["start", "account"]) # The order in which the auditor finds things on the filesystem is # not something we care about; what matters is only that it found # all of them. calls[2:6] = sorted(calls[2:6], key=lambda item: item[1][2]) sorted_account_dbs = sorted(['true1.db', 'true2.db', 'true3.db', 'fail1.db', 'fail2.db']) for i in range(2, 7): self.assertEqual(calls[i][0], "see_object") self.assertTrue(calls[i][1].find(sorted_account_dbs[i - 2])) self.assertEqual(calls[7], ["end"]) @mock.patch('swift.account.auditor.AccountBroker', FakeWatcherAccountBroker) def test_crashy_watchers(self): the_tempfile = TemporaryFile(mode="rw+b") class WorkingWatcher(object): def __init__(self, conf, logger): self._started = False self._ended = False pickle.dump(["__init__", type(self).__name__], the_tempfile) the_tempfile.flush() def start(self, audit_type): if self._started: raise Exception("don't call it twice") self._started = True pickle.dump(['start', type(self).__name__], the_tempfile) the_tempfile.flush() def see_object(self, *args): pickle.dump(['see_object', type(self).__name__], the_tempfile) the_tempfile.flush() def end(self): if self._ended: raise Exception("don't call it twice") self._ended = True pickle.dump(['end', type(self).__name__], the_tempfile) the_tempfile.flush() class CrashyInitWatcher(WorkingWatcher): def __init__(self, conf, logger): super(CrashyInitWatcher, self).__init__(conf, logger) raise Exception("I don't wanna") class CrashyProcessingWatcher(WorkingWatcher): def start(self, audit_type): super(CrashyProcessingWatcher, self).start(audit_type) raise Exception("oh man") def see_object(self, *args): super(CrashyProcessingWatcher, self).see_object(*args) raise Exception("it's getting weird") def end(self): super(CrashyProcessingWatcher, self).end() raise Exception("argh") def fake_audit_location_generator(*args, **kwargs): files = os.listdir(self.testdir) return [(os.path.join(self.testdir, f), '', '') for f in files] fake_entry_point1 = mock.Mock() fake_entry_point3 = mock.Mock() fake_entry_point3.configure_mock( load=lambda: CrashyProcessingWatcher, name='crashy_processing') def fake_iep(group, name=None): assert group == mock.patch('pkg_resources.iter_entry_points', fake_iep): my_auditor = auditor.AccountAuditor(conf, self.logger) with mock.patch('swift.account.auditor.audit_location_generator', fake_audit_location_generator): my_auditor.run_once() calls = [] the_tempfile.seek(0) while True: try: calls.append(pickle.load(the_tempfile)) except EOFError: break calls_by_handler = { commit_message:
Add Check and Recover into Node Action

This patch implements do_check and do_recover in node action.

Implements: blueprint support-health-management

Change-Id: I9ecf9469d8bafbfba11e11bcc27ff6dffed19423
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/68/264568/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_do_recover(self, mock_load): node = mock.Mock() node.id = 'NID' mock_load.return_value = node action = node_action.NodeAction(node.id, 'ACTION', self.ctx) # Test node recover failure path node.do_recover = mock.Mock(return_value=False) res_code, res_msg = action.do_recover() self.assertEqual(action.RES_ERROR, res_code) self.assertEqual('Node recover failed.', res_msg) node.do_recover.assert_called_once_with(action.context) node.reset_mock() # Test node recover success path node.do_recover = mock.Mock(return_value=True) res_code, res_msg = action.do_recover() self.assertEqual(action.RES_OK, res_code) self.assertEqual('Node recovered successfully.', res_msg) node.do_recover.assert_called_once_with(action.context)

commit_message:
Cap installed pip to be < 8

Pip 8 just release which made uninstalling distutils installed packages
fatal. This was previously a deprecation warning and is now causing all
dsvm jobs to fail.

Change-Id: I22f5c3af1adf96cfbd5747122f915a82e947843a
(cherry picked from commit 0ea729ac4908683141e5b1a9ca0d4a0d2390f5ad)
(cherry picked from commit 3937f39fe95743c578ef6a704a367b250bfbb4a8)

commit_message:
Cap installed pip to be < 8

Pip 8 just release which made uninstalling distutils installed packages
fatal. This was previously a deprecation warning and is now causing all
dsvm jobs to fail.

Change-Id: I22f5c3af1adf96cfbd5747122f915a82e947843a
(cherry picked from commit 0ea729ac4908683141e5b1a9ca0d4a0d2390f5ad)

commit_message:
Fix codes using dict.iteritems() for python3

Stop using dict.iteritems() since it has been removed in python3.
Replace dict(obj.iteritems()) with dict(obj).

Partially implements blueprint: nova-python3-mitaka

Change-Id: I497e6380721bc8b0c9b173b86f18b9e72722fd06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/269485/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return {k: v for k, v in obj.items() existing_node = dict(self.item)
deleted_lines: if isinstance(obj, dict): obj_items = obj.items() else: obj_items = obj.iteritems() return {k: v for k, v in obj_items existing_node = dict(self.item.iteritems())
